snippet: In the N.F.L., four of the top six individual single-season passing marks — including one by Eli Manning of the Super Bowl champion Giants — were set in 2011.
abstract: NFL Preview; passing continues to trump rushing in the NFL, with last season being the 28th in a row that teams averaged more passes a game than rushes a game.
lead_paragraph: In the N.F.L., four of the top six individual single-season passing marks — including one by Eli Manning of the Super Bowl champion Giants — were set in 2011.

headline.seo: Across the N.F.L., Offenses Are Taking to the Air Like Never Before
headline.main: 30 Yards in the Air or 3 Yards in the Dust?
headline.print_headline: 30 Yards in the Air Or 3 Yards in the Dust?
